descriptionSet.description: Shashikala, one of the main actresses of Vinod Kumar's "Jahan Ara" is depicted running down the stairs into a hall of a palace, where Mala Sinha is sitting above a flight of stairs. The stairs have a number of tiger hide rugs lying on them. The hall is decorated in the Mughal style with pillars and arches.

inscription.text: written & directed by Vinod Kumar music Madan Mohan lyrics Rajinder Krishan camera G. Singh art Sant Singh produced by Om Prakash Bakshi

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: written & directed by Vinod Kumar music Madan Mohan lyrics Rajinder Krishan camera G. Singh art Sant Singh produced by Om Prakash Bakshi

description-en: Shashikala, one of the main actresses of Vinod Kumar's "Jahan Ara" is depicted running down the stairs into a hall of a palace, where Mala Sinha is sitting above a flight of stairs. The stairs have a number of tiger hide rugs lying on them. The hall is decorated in the Mughal style with pillars and arches. (gs/sp)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: This cinema lobby card from Jahan Ara (Vinod Kumar, 1964) encapsulates the dream-like beauty of a quasi-Mughal imaginary. (Rosie Thomas)(gs)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: The padded tigers next to Mala Sinha contribute to the orientalist image constructed in this image. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Two genres dominated India’s B-movie circuit in the 1950s: stunt and fantasy films – otherwise referred to as ‘fighting’ and ‘magic’ (or ‘jadoo’) films. The former refers to all manner of action films, which invariably drew openly on the Hollywood ‘low’ genres popular in India since the silent era. India’s fantasy films, on the other hand, were spun around magical and wondrous happenings in a quasi-Arabian Islamicate setting, most drawing loosely on oral and literary traditions of the Arabian Nights. (Rosie Thomas) (gs)
related literature: Said, Edward 1995. "Orientalism". London: Penguin Books. (gs)
related literature: Thomas, Rosie 2010. "Still Magic. An Aladdin's Cave of 1950s B-Movie Fantasy" http://www.tasveergharindia.net/cmsdesk/essay/103/index.html, last accessed 2010-11-18. 18. (gs)
